summary: This is a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request filed by New York Times reporter Danielle Ivory to the Bureau of Prisons on August 13, 2019, seeking records related to Jeffrey Epstein's death by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. The request specifically asks for video footage, documents about his suicide and suicide attempt, records about the decision to remove him from suicide watch, investigation reports, and correspondence with the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Danielle Ivory
persons.context: New York Times reporter who filed the FOIA request to the Bureau of Prisons seeking records about Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FOIA request; an accused sex trafficker who died by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Death at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: FOIA Request Filed
events.description: New York Times reporter Danielle Ivory filed a FOIA request with the Bureau of Prisons seeking records related to Epstein's death and the events surrounding it.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019.
The FOIA request seeks video footage and all BOP documents pertaining to Epstein's suicide and an earlier suicide attempt.
The request specifically asks for records related to the decision to remove Epstein from suicide watch.
The requester argues there is extreme public interest due to conspiracy theories and the need to understand government operations.
The document is a formal FOIA request from a New York Times reporter to the Bureau of Prisons.
